definition: abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: 'They only pay attention to physics, mathematics and chemistry, ' says Mr. Pei.
sentences.chinese: 裴东光说，他们只关心数理化。

sentences.english: They helped Mr. Pei and his colleague organize funding for teacher workshops.
sentences.chinese: 他们帮助裴东光和他的同事筹措了教师培训的资金。

sentences.english: The meeting was hosted by Director Pei of Fancheng District People's Congress.
sentences.chinese: 演讲知识培训由樊城区人大裴主任主持。

sentences.english: 'They only pay attention to physics, mathematics and chemistry, ' says Mr.
sentences.chinese: 裴东光说，他们只关心数理化。

sentences.english: 'They thought it was just a sports competition, ' Mr. Pei says. 'No one cared.'
sentences.chinese: 裴东光说，他们认为这只是一场体育赛事，没人关心。

sentences.english: So who is right – Pei or Yang?
sentences.chinese: 那么，谁说的对，是裴还是杨？

sentences.english: But Indian fascination with China's economic success is also simplistic, Mr. Pei said.
sentences.chinese: 裴先生说，印度对中国经济成就的迷恋也很简单。

sentences.english: Mr. Pei hopes Olympic education will continue after the Olympics are over.
sentences.chinese: 裴东光希望奥林匹克教育能在奥运会结束后保持下去。

definition: pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
surname Xue/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
high mountain/highest peak of a mountain ridge
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
